title: Statistics Sanctuary
story: Understanding your data is the first step in ML! NumPy provides powerful statistical functions to analyze datasets. Mean, median, and standard deviation help you understand data distribution - essential for preprocessing and model evaluation.
instructions: Import numpy as np. Create array `dataset` with [2, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5, 7, 9]. Calculate `mean_val` using .mean(), `median_val` using np.median(), and `std_val` (standard deviation) using .std(). Print all three values.
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np
dataset = np.array([2, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5, 7, 9])
mean_val = dataset.mean()
median_val = np.median(dataset)
std_val = dataset.std()
print(mean_val)
print(median_val)
print(std_val)

hints.text: Use array.mean() for mean, np.median(array) for median, array.std() for standard deviation
Mean is average, median is middle value, std measures spread around mean
mean_val = dataset.mean(), median_val = np.median(dataset), std_val = dataset.std()
